body_content.explanation: to acclimatize (= change to suit different conditions of life, weather, etc.) again, especially after a period of time in a different place or situation, or to help a person or an animal do this:
examples: The England team had to quickly reacclimatize to the colder conditions back home.
The animals were reacclimatized to outdoor temperatures before release.
Ideally you will take a day or two to re-acclimatise your body to eating regular foods.
The company wants to help women reacclimate to their careers after spending several years raising young children.
